page.title: 15Bradley Parish Clerk
page.content: It is the job of the Parish Clerk to help the Parish Council look after the the village.There are 7 people on the the council,they have 4 meetings a year and look after such things as the playing field,the fences,the roads and telephone box,notice boards,litter bins,help with the churchyard and run a playscheme.The money to do this comes from a big office in Stafford, the Borough Council,and is part of the rates.The Parish Clerk looks after the money,she pays the bills and does the accounts.Upstairs in her house she has a little office in a corner of a room where she keeps her blue typewriter on a big desk and a cupboard full of folders. She writes letters and telephones, arranges for the fences to be mended and the swings to be painted in the playing field,and the roads to be cleared when it snows.
